message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The inferior mesenteric artery supplies blood to the descending colon, sigmoid colon, and rectum. Based on the location of the occlusion, the rectosigmoid colon is the most likely structure to be affected, which can explain the patient’s symptoms of severe abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The inferior mesenteric artery supplies the left colonic flexure, descending colon, and rectum. The rectosigmoid colon is the most likely to be affected in this patient. Options B, C, and D are not supplied by the inferior mesenteric artery.
